intro: Cyananthus hookeri var. levicaulis, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, preferring cool and moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. This variant is distinguished by its more elongated stems compared to other Cyananthus species.
